discussion.content: As per my test, root guard will disable loopguard, but all the other commands are good.

questions.question_text: Which of the following commands can be issued without interfering with the operation of loop guard?

discussion.content:
The well-known HSRP Virtual MAC address of 0000.0c07.acXX, where XX is the HSRP group identifier.Also the Default group number would be set to group 0. 
So "B" is Correct

The full syntax of the command above is:
standby [group-number] ip [ip-address [secondary]]
As you can see group-number isn't a mandatory parameter and in this case HSRP will be use default group-number=0 to form HSRP MAC address. So the right answer is B.

questions.question_text:
The following command was issued on a router that is being configured as the active HSRP router. standby ip 10.2.1.1
Which statement is true about this command?

choices.D: The HSRP MAC address will be 0000.070c ad01.
choices.C: The HSRP MAC address will be 0000 0c07 ac01.
choices.B: The HSRP MAC address will be 0000 0c07 ac00
choices.E: This command will not work because the active parameter is missing
choices.A: This command will not work because the HSRP group information is missing

choices.D: A sticky MAC address ages out of the MAC address table after 600 seconds.
choices.A: A sticky MAC address is retained when the switch reboots.
choices.C: A sticky MAC address is lost when the switch reboots.
choices.B: A sticky MAC address can be a unicast or multicast address.

comments.content: copy run start is specified within the question so I believe A is the correct answer.

discussion.content: Ansieranno shoud be C We nave to save the Mac learned on startup config

questions.question_text: Which statement about the MAC address sticky entries in the switch when the copy run start command is entered is true?

choices.A: Only if both tracked objects are up will this router will be available as an AVF for group 1.
choices.C: If both tracked objects go down and then one comes up, but the other remains down, this router will be available as an AVF for group 1.
choices.E: If the state of one tracked object goes down, then this router will release its status as an AVF for group 1.
choices.D: This configuration is incorrect and will not have any effect on GLBP operation.
choices.B: Only if the state of both tracked objects goes down will this router release its status as an AVF for group 1.

discussion.content: B is correct but I also think so does C. If one comes back up, the priority would be 95 - higher than the min, so the router will be available

comments.content:
Not correct. Should be:

"Implementation Components

Implementation of a network design consists of several phases (install hardware, configure systems, launch into production, and so on). Each phase consists of several steps, and each step should contain, but be not limited to, the following documentation:

Description of the step
Reference to design documents
Detailed implementation guidelines
Detailed roll-back guidelines in case of failure
Estimated time needed for implementation"

Reference to design documentation
Roll back guidelines
Detailed implementation plan
Time required to perform the implementation
